snippet.title: Woman hit by car
snippet.content: A WOMAN is fighting for her life after being hit by a car in Mount Louisa on Thursday night. The Bulletin understands the woman was walking with a man when she was struck about 7pm at the roundabout at the intersection of Bayswater Rd and Crestbrook Drive. Emergency services including a critical care paramedic raced to the scene and found the woman unconscious with a suspected broken leg. She was stabilised before being rushed to Townsville Hospital in a critical condition. Forensic crash police were called to the scene. A number of witnesses were also helping investigators. The age of the woman has not been released. Motorists were urged to avoid the area.
